summary: Micron Technology reported strong financial performance for fiscal Q2 2024, with total revenue reaching $5.8 billion, a 23% increase sequentially and a 58% increase year-over-year. The company achieved a gross margin of 20%, driven primarily by improved pricing, and returned to profitability ahead of expectations. Strategic initiatives include a focus on high-value solutions and maintaining a stable bit share, with a particular emphasis on data center products and high-capacity DIMMs. Market conditions have improved significantly, contributing to a favorable supply-demand balance, and Micron anticipates positive free cash flow for the second half of fiscal 2024, projecting record revenue in fiscal 2025. Notably, the company is seeing strong customer demand for its 128GB products, which are expected to generate several hundred million dollars in revenue this fiscal year. However, the company did not provide specific details on prepayments, indicating potential uncertainty in that area, and highlighted risks related to market demand fluctuations and pricing trends.
key_highlights: Micron's fiscal Q2 revenue was $5.8 billion, up 23% sequentially and 58% year-over-year.
The company achieved a gross margin of 20%, primarily driven by improved pricing.
Micron is focusing on high-value solutions, particularly in the data center market.
Strong customer demand for 128GB products is expected to generate significant revenue.
The company did not comment on prepayments, indicating potential uncertainty in that area.

metrics.description: Operating cash flows for fiscal Q2.
Free cash flow was near breakeven.
Days inventory outstanding for fiscal Q2.

kpis.name: Revenue Growth
kpis.value: 39% sequential increase in Storage Business Unit revenue
kpis.context: Storage Business Unit revenue was $905 million, up 39% sequentially with strong double-digit growth across all end markets.

kpis.name: Market Share
kpis.value: Data center SSD revenue more than doubled YoY
kpis.context: Driven by share gains for Micron's products.

kpis.name: Gross Margin
kpis.context: Consolidated gross margin for fiscal Q2 was 20%, up 19 percentage points sequentially driven by higher pricing.

kpis.name: Operating Income
kpis.context: Generated operating income of $204 million in fiscal Q2.

kpis.name: NAND Revenue Growth
kpis.context: Fiscal Q2 NAND revenue was approximately $1.6 billion, representing 27% of Micron's total revenue.

kpis.name: Customer Demand
kpis.context: AI server demand is driving rapid growth in HBM, DDR5, and data center SSDs.

kpis.name: Operational Efficiency
kpis.context: Underutilization charges were modest and related to legacy manufacturing capacity, expected to sustain lower levels moving forward.

kpis.name: Earnings Per Share
kpis.context: Expected earnings per share based on a share count of approximately 1.1 billion shares.

operational_metrics.description: Consolidated gross margin for fiscal Q2, up 19 percentage points sequentially driven by higher pricing.
Generated operating income in fiscal Q2.
Operating margin for fiscal Q2, turning positive a quarter earlier than originally forecasted.
Compared to a loss per share of $0.95 in the prior quarter.
Net benefit for income taxes recognized in fiscal Q2.
Revenue for the Storage Business Unit, up 39% sequentially.
Driven by share gains for Micron's products.
Projected earnings per share based on a share count of approximately 1.1 billion shares.

risk_factors.description: The matters discussed include forward-looking statements regarding market demand and supply, market and pricing trends and drivers, which are subject to risks and uncertainties that may cause actual results to differ materially from statements made.
Risks associated with documents filed with the SEC, including the most recent Form 10-Q and upcoming 10-Q, which discuss risks that may affect future results.
The supply-demand balance in the industry may fluctuate, impacting pricing and revenue.
The costs related to HBM may weigh on cost down performance, impacting overall margins despite favorable product mix.

strategic_initiatives.progress: Leading edge is running at full utilization.
strategic_initiatives.impact: Supports growth in revenue and profits.

strategic_initiatives.progress: Shifting the mix of products towards more profitable parts of the market.
strategic_initiatives.impact: Increased revenue from high-capacity DIMMs and HBM.

strategic_initiatives.progress: Resumption of cost downs and favorable mix effects are expected.
